title: Low Livestock Production Index
description: In 2022, Myanmar's livestock production index was at 35.52, indicating one of the lowest levels globally compared to the 2014-2016 baseline.

title: Weak Human Resource Development
description: Myanmar's CPIA building human resources rating was 1.5 in 2023, reflecting a low capacity in developing human capital.

title: Poor Governance and Property Rights
description: With a CPIA property rights and rule-based governance rating of 1 in 2023, Myanmar ranks among the lowest in ensuring effective governance and property rights.

title: Limited Trade Capacity
description: In 2023, Myanmar's CPIA trade rating was 1.5, indicating significant challenges in trade facilitation and policy.

title: Low Manufacturing in Food and Beverages
description: In 2020, food, beverages, and tobacco accounted for only 0.29% of Myanmar's manufacturing value added, highlighting a minimal contribution from this sector.

title: Negligible Machinery and Transport Equipment Manufacturing
description: Machinery and transport equipment made up just 0.006% of Myanmar's manufacturing value added in 2020, indicating a very small industrial base in this sector.

title: High-Tech Manufacturing Dominance
description: In 2022, medium and high-tech manufacturing constituted 92.58% of Myanmar's manufacturing value added, showcasing a strong focus on advanced manufacturing processes.

title: Short Compulsory Education Duration
description: Myanmar mandates only 5 years of compulsory education as of 2023, one of the shortest durations globally.

title: High Female Representation in Tertiary Education
description: In 2018, 84.53% of academic staff in Myanmar's tertiary education were female, indicating a strong female presence in higher education.

title: Low Prevalence of Overweight in Young Children
description: The prevalence of overweight among children under 5 was 0.5% for females in 2018 and 0.6% in 2024, suggesting low levels of childhood overweight issues.
